definition: overwhelming
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This is a devastating and, I think, brilliant argument.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这是压倒性的，极其精彩的论证。

sentences.english: Their overwhelming numbers could destroy us.
sentences.chinese: 单凭他们那庞大的压倒性的人数就可以之我们于死地。

sentences.english: The evidence is overwhelming and the only real disagreement is about intensity.
sentences.chinese: 证据也是压倒性的，只有在强度方面有不同意见。

sentences.english: There is sufficient evidence that the bird is the offspring of maniraptoran dinosaur.
sentences.chinese: 压倒性的证据显示鸟类是手盗龙的后代。

sentences.english: He won the election by a large majority, and has become his party's fair-haired boy.
sentences.chinese: 他以压倒性的多数票当选，已成为党内的红人。

sentences.english: 1：What are the biggest election landslides in modern history?
sentences.chinese: 近代史上，哪几次大选取得了最大的压倒性胜利？

sentences.english: Still, Ravitch's compilation of evidence and argument is overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，拉维切汇集的证据和讨论是压倒性的。

sentences.english: Kennett, of course, was the incumbent and overwhelming favourite in that election.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼特当然，是在该选举现任和压倒性的最爱。

sentences.english: Mr. Erdogan won last year's general election with a landslide victory.
sentences.chinese: 埃尔多安去年以压倒性胜利赢得大选。

definition: on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
to predominate/to occupy a dominant position
evenly matched (idiom)
to occupy/to hold
to defeat/to smash/to rout
victorious/to win/to triumph
decisive/conclusive
unsurpassed/unparalleled
to dominate/dominant
to overwhelm/to overpower/overwhelming
superiority/dominance/advantage
to cower by military force/deterrence
leeward/downwind/disadvantageous position/to concede or give way in an argument
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
